Content:: The lacrimal fossa (or fossa for lacrimal gland) is located on the inferior surface of each orbital plate of the frontal bone. It is smooth and concave, and presents, laterally, underneath the zygomatic process, a shallow depression for the lacrimal gland. This article incorporates text in the public domain from page 137 of the 20th edition of Gray's Anatomy (1918)  This human musculoskeletal system article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
